meanings.definition: To move slowly on hands and knees
meanings.sent1: The baby crawled across the floor.
meanings.sent2: The injured soldier crawled to safety.
meanings.sent3: The snail crawled faster than the turtle!
meanings.sent4: Time crawled by as he waited for the test results.
meanings.sent5: The spider crawled up the wall, its legs moving delicately.

meanings.definition: To advance slowly or with difficulty
meanings.sent1: The traffic crawled along the congested highway.
meanings.sent2: The hiker crawled up the steep mountain trail.
meanings.sent3: The line at the grocery store crawled at a snail's pace.
meanings.sent4: The project crawled forward despite numerous setbacks.
meanings.sent5: The old car crawled up the hill, struggling with each inch.

meanings.definition: To be covered with or full of crawling things
meanings.sent1: The rotten log crawled with insects.
meanings.sent2: The abandoned house crawled with spiders and cobwebs.
meanings.sent3: The picnic blanket crawled with ants after being left unattended.
meanings.sent4: The forest floor crawled with all sorts of creepy-crawlies.
meanings.sent5: The dark cave entrance crawled with unknown creatures, making them hesitate to enter.
